item.title: Sarah add a quote by steve martin
item.description: "I believe entertainment can aspire to be art, and can become art, but if you set out to make art you're an idiot." -- steve martin

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "I understood that as much as I had resisted the outside, as much as I had constricted my life, as much as I had closed and narrowed the channels into me, there were still many takers for the quiet heart." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "A short story is a different thing all together - a short story is like a kiss in the dark from a stranger." -- Stephen King

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you liked being a teenager, there's something really wrong with you." -- Stephen King

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You donâ€™t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Sarah add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "To love at all is to be vulnerable. Love anything and your heart will be wrung and possibly broken. If you want to make sure of keeping it intact you must give it to no one, not even an animal. Wrap it carefully round with hobbies and little luxuries; avoid all entanglements. Lock it up safe in the casket or coffin of your selfishness. But in that casket, safe, dark, motionless, airless, it will change. It will not be broken; it will become unbreakable, impenetrable, irredeemable. To love is to be vulnerable." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Douglas Preston & Lincoln Child
item.description: "Already up to his waist in the quaking bog, Pendergast stopped struggling and stared up at his assassin. The icy glitter in the pale gray eyes spoke more eloquently of his hatred and despair than any words he might have spoken, and it shook Esterhazy to the core." -- Douglas Preston & Lincoln Child

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Justin Cronin
item.description: "He breathed once more, holding the air in his chest, as if it were not air but something more--a sweet taste of freedom, of all cares lifted, everything over and done." -- Justin Cronin

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Graham Joyce
item.description: "She couldn't see him, but his voice was like light through a stained-glass window in a cathedral." -- Graham Joyce

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Graham Joyce
item.description: "They were an end-of-days couple, not naked in a garden but wrapped in layers in a snow-covered landscape where there were no more apples on the trees and women would no longer have to take the blame because the old lie had been covered over by snow." -- Graham Joyce

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Graham Joyce
item.description: "The awesome silence of the place crept up on her. The spruce and pines, all still laden with snow, spread their limbs in a frozen ballet, breathing a ghostly incense from dark, arid chapels sheltered by their branches." -- Graham Joyce

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Graham Joyce
item.description: "The blood in my veins is frozen but it sings of love." -- Graham Joyce

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Anne Ursu
item.description: "Sometimes superheroes are born, sometimes they are made. Sometimes they make themselves. Sometimes all it takes is will." -- Anne Ursu

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Aimee Bender
item.description: "We hit the sidewalk, and dropped hands. How I wished, right then, that the whole world was a street." -- Aimee Bender

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Aimee Bender
item.description: "I admired that stride; it was like he folded space in two with it." -- Aimee Bender

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Aimee Bender
item.description: "Mom flipped through the magazines like the pages needed to be slapped." -- Aimee Bender

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Leif Enger
item.description: "A line only gets grace when it curves, you know." -- Leif Enger

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Leif Enger
item.description: "...for his life seemed a curving line, capricious, moment by moment inviting grace." -- Leif Enger

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Leif Enger
item.description: "I felt laden. Air itself has weight and mass, and Kansas had the most air of anywhere I'd ever been." -- Leif Enger

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Jesse Kellerman
item.description: "Charisma is a mysterious and powerful thing. I have it in limited supply, and that which I do have functions under highly specialized conditions." -- Jesse Kellerman

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Jesse Kellerman
item.description: "...in seduction, as in all forms of marketing, form superseds content." -- Jesse Kellerman

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Glen David Gold
item.description: "Faith was a choice. So, it followed, was wonder." -- Glen David Gold

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mary Doria Russell
item.description: "Show God what yer made of, man. Pucker up and kiss the cross." -- Mary Doria Russell

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Mary Doria Russell
item.description: "She was held in the tension just before movement, about to walk back toward the house. Later she would think, If I had turned away, I'd have missed the moment he fell in love. He would not remember it that way. What he experienced was not so much the beginning of love as a cessation of pain." -- Mary Doria Russell

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Douglas Preston & Lincoln Child
item.description: "He found Pendergast's cool gaze on him, and he fidgeted. He'd forgotten about those eyes. They made you feel like you had just been stripped of your secrets." -- Douglas Preston & Lincoln Child

item.title: Sarah add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sarah add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Fate is like a strange, unpopular restaurant filled with odd little waiters who bring you things you never asked for and don't always like." -- Lemony Snicket
